key_issues: Back up water/council connection: Council requested work stopped. Investigation of site pending. Municipal Solutions assisting.
Borehole: Public participation notice posted 4 Oct 2025 for 30 days. Final document for location of holes being completed.
Nuhuman (Shop 23 + Outside Seating): Liquidated end Aug 2025, gone into voluntary liquidation. 702 m2 vacant. R481,424 outstanding.
Boom Gate Services: Cost increased 12.5% from R3,750 to R4,562.40 per month. Investigating replacement options.
EV Charger: SLA to be amended, no exclusivity. Tenant to reinstate and cannot remove cable when in breach.
Walkway ceilings paint work: Phase 1 in progress, completion January 2026. Phase 2 (roof and facade) starts January.
Valve chamber awaiting council connection for water system in centre.

net_income_entity_vs_property.explanation: Large variance expected. PDF net income (R14,148,071) is the property co-ownership trust net income for 10 months (Mar-Dec 2025). GL ebitda_recurring (R3,630,574 = negative in GL convention means profit) is the ENTITY-level recurring EBITDA for the same 10 months, which nets entity revenue (management fees of R3,747,879) against entity operating costs (R117,305 excl finance charges and FV adjustments). The entity receives a management fee from the co-ownership which is only a fraction of the property NOI. The co-ownership trust distributes to multiple co-owners; only a portion flows to this entity.

revenue_report_vs_gl.explanation: PDF total income (R24,904,710) is total property-level income for the co-ownership trust (rent, recoveries, parking, etc). GL gross_profit (R3,747,879) is the entity-level revenue which consists solely of management fees received from the Chartwell Co-Ownership. The entity does not record property rental income directly - it receives a management fee distribution from the co-ownership trust.

insured_vs_book.explanation: Building sum insured (R216,000,000) is 2.38x the AFS investment property carrying value (R90,670,708 at Feb 2025). The AFS value reflects a significant fair value write-down (R14.3M in FY2025 taking it from R109.8M to R90.7M). The insured value represents replacement cost which typically exceeds book/market value. Note: municipal valuation is R78.3M, also below insured value. The 2.38x ratio suggests adequate insurance coverage relative to replacement cost, though the property is deeply impaired on the books.

_derivation_notes.weighted_escalation: GLA-weighted average escalation across tenants with known escalation rates. Checkers 4% (3,691m2) + Woolworths 0% (709m2) + Pick n Pay 5.5% (289m2) + Crazy Pets 8% (346m2) + Bootleggers 6% (220m2) + Miladys N/A + Crazy Store 6% (192m2) + Tasko 7% (129m2) + Manic Cure 7% (105m2) + Hao Li Lai 7% (96m2) + Dr Kezia N/A (84m2) + Execuspecs 8% (81m2) + Fix Tech 7% (81m2) + Craft Hair 8% (71m2) + Moroccan 6% (71m2) + Red Hot 7% (71m2) + Pool Team 6.5% (70m2) + Cannafrica 6% (70m2) + Biltong 7% (23m2) + Puff Co 5% (8m2) + VO Connect 7% (1m2) + MTN 6.5% (1m2). Weighted = approx 6.38% across 5,429 m2 with known escalations.
